It also contained peppers and onions but no bean sprouts. I ordered the Las Vegas roll which was excellent btw and although I didn't plan on ordering desert it would've been nice to have been asked. I guess our waitress wanted us out asap even though it wasn't close to closing time yet. I could tell she was in a hurry when she brought the check over along with a to-go box we'd asked for and the fortune cookies. She proceeded to hang out really close and asked twice if we were ready. So, if you want to chat after your meal I guess hurry up and pay first! LOL Overall the food was OK to great depending on what you order and the service was just OK. We'll come back because they had good sushi and there is nothing closer to us for sushi, otherwise we'd probably skip Sun Asian in the future.

Good food! I won't discount that, but when you have food delivered you kinda should bring condiments with you. I ordered sushi and there was no wasabi and ginger :-( and I really wanted the spice today. The killer roll is good on the sushi menu and I love their beef and broccoli!!!

Lunch time specials are really great and affordable. The food arrived fast and the presentation was clean and appealing.  The sushi is great!! While I order the orange chicken and it was delicious, it was hard not to be jealous of my co-worker eating the yummy sushi!! Fresh, flavors on point and nice portions.  Try this out for lunch and you wont be disappointed!

The food here is always so good. I've been coming here since they opened. They have a great lunch special and yummy boba you can order to go. Their sushi is a bit on the pricey side but then again they're more focused on their main entrees. If you are craving Asian food and want a nice sit down place, this is definitely a good place to go. Great drinks too!

I got here around 1015pm on a Friday night and the place of business closes at 11pm. I notice some of that the staff members were very rude and trying to get people out there as quickly as possible. Which is fine I understand. However, on the customers end it's really bad!  They were literally hawking you from the distance and as soon as you were done with a plate they came over immediately to confiscate. On the other hand, food did come out pretty quickly and drinks too. Food was ok. I'd prefer some where else for sushi.

Great happy hour prices with a good size happy hour menu. The food is average, but on the cheaper side as well. If you want good sushi on a budget, this is your place. Avocado boats and Philly rolls are my favorite here. They do have most of your typical Asian cuisine as well. Ambiance is nice, casual dining, good for groups, kid friendly.
We are regular's at this place and always enjoy the orange chicken and their amazing crispy honey chicken.  The food is always fresh and the staff are friendly.  Highly recommend!!

I have been here a few times and I enjoy Sun Asian Kitchen.  The staff here is very friendly and attentive.  The last time we came I had the orange chicken which was crispy and very tasty.  My girlfriend had the beef lo main which was also very good.  I have come here in the past for various lunches and have always had a good experience.  I recommend stopping in if you are in the area.

Food was decent.  Customizing an order is challenging over the phone.  Brought wrong sushi roll, and when asked to replace the roll, offered only to change the fish that sat on top instead of the entire roll. Not very knowledgable of what good customer service means.  As the community develops I hope this restaurant has more competition so service will improve.

Sun Asian has an eclectic decor that makes me think of what would happen if a foreign tourist had dinner once in a PF Changs, then tried to re-create it from memory a decade later. It attempts to be trendy but ends up looking like a loft apartment that was well-decorated, then occupied by someone's grandmother who didn't have the best taste. It is at least open and airy, though.  It is a semi-regular lunch spot for me and my co-workers, since it is really easy to get tired of going to Chipotle over and over on the corner of 24th and Baseline, and I refuse to go to Ono Hawaiian Grill. Yuck.  The staff is generally friendly and chipper, if a bit too informal. On a couple of occasions I have had to wait a while to be greeted at my table, but 90% of the time it is a quick in and out lunch.  The food is average-to-decent chinese fare with average sushi and a couple of other asian cuisines thrown in. It is nothing earth-shattering, but it is reliably decent.  I always order the veggies in garlic sauce, but substitute crispy fried tofu. The fried tofu is always well-seasoned and cooked just right. The rice is, let's be honest, mediocre shopping center chinese restaurant rice, but it is perfectly acceptable.  It is a great place to grab lunch for 7 or 8 bucks.

I write this review with tremendous disappointment. I've gone to this restaurant and loved it for years. Tonight I had orange chicken to tasted like fish. I called them to voice my complaint they offered to replace it. I drove back up there and found they didn't even start to cook the replacement. They haggled over replacing the rice too. They acted like they didn't care  at all. When thwy finally replaced it and then the second batch tasted like fish also. I called to talk to a manager. He didn't care, talked over me the whole time on the phone. He asked if I wanted to come get my money. I didn't feel like driving for a third time. I said no, I was going to offer he give me a credit for next time. Instead, before I got the chance to say it, he hung up on me. I am done. I will never go back again.

If you work in the Sky Harbor area and want a hot, sit down, full lunch with drink for less than $10 that includes the tip than this place is it! Their lunch specials are under $6 and very filling. All your favorite dishes! Meal comes with egg roll and rice and it's a pretty harty portion. My husband loves this place too, wish it was close to my house.

OK, I HAVE to give this place 5 stars because they server THE BEST Chinese food I have ever had.  Their sushi is mediocre, and so is their service, but their food is brilliant.  Every piece of meat was tender, their shrimp was well cleaned and cooked, and high quality to begin with.  I am definitely going back, I just might get take out next time...

I used to come here A lot when I worked at UOP. Product quality changed.  They gave me a spring roll instead of an egg roll then told me I was wrong.  Server forgot to put my order in so I waited a while.  There was no one in here so it was really obvious when she remembered to put in my order.  The Orange chicken are smaller, the noodles changed to the ones at panda... It wasn't terrible,  but it wasn't as good as it was.  I went out of my way to stop in.  I won't do that again.

Tried this place for the first time tonight.  We ordered 7 different appetizers and one egg foo young.  It was a ton of food and I only paid 34 dollars.  All the appetizers were happy hour price.  I highly, highly recommend it.  In fact, I kinda wish we didn't order an entree because we got full off appetizers.  But the waitstaff was lovely and the place is a lot cheerier than you would expect. I only knocked off a star because the booth was a little hard on the rear and the boba balls were a little mushy. Lol at that sentence.  All in all I had a good experience.  My recommendation: squid salad!

Had the chicken fried rice this afternoon and since then had stomach ache and diarrhea. Also feel drowsy, it could be the MSG that's added but even the food was served cold and tasteless. I don't think I will be having Chinese food anytime sooner, not going back, need to put this out of my memory.
Absolutely wonderful. The prices were very reasonable, food delicious, and the service was quick and courteous. My only compliant is that they only have one location! I highly recommend this place.

Went there for lunch last week. The lady slammed our drinks on the table. Food was fast coming out but sadly my brown rice was hard and sticky. Not sure I will be going back. Service was a -1. The staff is not very friendly.

Food portions were large and hot. I ordered pick up and they gave me a reasonable time for my food to be ready. The price for four items, came out to be a little more than $35. But in the south mountain area there aren't many other Chinese restaurants better.

We're all clear that wanting to like something is not the same as liking it, right?  Well, I want to love this place.  It's the closest non-take out Chinese food place to my house so I was completely ready to make this "My Chinese Restaurant".  Unfortunately it doesn't quite live up to the hype.    It is all good.  It's fine.  Some parts better than others.  Entrees are in the $8 range for chicken/beef dishes, in the $16 range for seafood and they offer a few specialty dishes up to the early $20's.  They have a decent section of vegetarian things as well, but less than you might expect at a Chinese restaurant.  There was more "sweet" in the sesame chicken than in the Orange chicken - and they looked far too much like the same thing.    The interior is kinda cool with funky lamps, window hangings and lots of bamboo.  For a spot that size the bar, where you can also sit and eat, is a bit too big for me - but just because those 2 big screen tv's are pointing out to the rest of the restaurant so we can't help but be reminded it's there.  The service?  Not so bueno.  I've been there 3 times and once it was good, but not great.  The other times have been pretty off each time.    I read a great review about the place by a professional reviewer claiming that it was similar to San Francisco Chinese food fare.  I'm guessing he's wrong, but I wanted to put it out here for other folks to see. http://www.somonews.com/article.cfm?articleID=242  I'd love to hear what you Bay area transplants have to say...

We're not in New York or San Francisco, two cities where I've lived, so the chinese food isn't going to be spectacular.  However, when you need your chinese fix, or don't feel like making dinner, Sun Asian has quality chinese food at a decent price.  Plus, they deliver now!
One of the better places in town to eat sushi. Service is a little slow sometimes but prices are reasonable.

Alright - I am going to update this review because Sun Asian Kitchen is a frequent stop for me.  No it's not the best (Chinese) food I have ever eaten. But their sushi is pretty darn great, plus they have a bar, iced mochas (not joking), Americanized Food items, and they deliver.  I recently just got their Sushi Salad (Tuna, White Tuna, Mango, Avocado, crisp lettuce, shredded carrots, cherry tomatoes and a spicy sweet sauce) and it was heaven. I am updating my review just because of this.  I gotta give them props, since they're in South Phoenix. We're lucky they exist out here.  You keep up the good fight Sun Asian Kitchen, and I'll ordering delivery from you (since it's hot and I am too lazy to drive).  Recommended:  Happy Hour - It's cheap Drinks - Fun times Delivery - Awesome convenience Sushi - Pretty tasty  Not: The Chinese Food (unless you do like Americanized Chinese Food)

Food is typical greasy American "Chinese" food. Sushi is horrible, I ordered a Alaskan roll and when it was brought to me I had to ask what roll I got thinking they gave  me the wrong one. I sent it back after they confirmed it was what I ordered. The manager tried to harass me into getting something else or I would still have to pay for the sushi I didn't eat. Then to make things worse my waiter asked me if I needed change when I gave him a $20 for a $8 bill and when he does give me change he gives me 2 $5. Really?!!  Will never make the mistake of coming here again.

Didn't expect much of this place when I saw it but it totally surprised me with how good the food was! Great value too. We had the crispy honey chicken, garlic short ribs and honey walnut shrimp and all of them tasted great! Hot sour soup was perfect as well with the right amount of spice. Will recommend this place to anyone...
I ordered online and it was ready in 5 minutes. I ordered the spicy tuna handroll and the california handroll. Both were delicious!!

I work down the street so this is my go-to place for Chinese food during lunch. I often call the order in at 10:50am and it's done and ready for pickup by 11:05. Their lunch menu is cheap and they have so many options and flavors are on point! I always get the lemon chicken with fried rice lunch combo, which comes with a veggie egg roll. The portion size is very generous, and I always pick it up piping hot and fresh. Some Chinese restaurants will make lemon chicken with overly breaded chicken, but this place uses real chunks of chicken and is lightly breaded, so when you take a bite, you see a big piece of chicken and not all fried breading. The lemon sauce is perfectly sweet, tangy, sour, just the way it should be. The fried rice is good and not too greasy. The veggie egg roll is a nice size and comes with sweet and sour sauce which is always good! For less than $7 bucks, this place is definitely a winner!

Sun Asian Kitchen was a nice little place. Modern looking, yet had a definite Asian-owned feel. No loud music, had some TVs and a bar. Happy hour menu looked pretty legit. The service friendly and pretty fast.  My friend and I ordered the chicken egg rolls (eggzcellent) the fish fillet with black bean sauce (a little salty, but to be expected with black bean sauce), and the lemon pepper chicken (which didn't have that strong of a lemon flavor, but still good). This place definitely surprised us. We wanted to try it for a while. I definitely recommend it.

Until we discovered Sun Asian, we were going to Pan Asia down the street. Sun Asian is fast, friendly, and has GREAT food. They are very attentive and friendly. They always have our lunches out quickly as they are conscious of our time crunch. Very good lunch specials and much less expensive than the alternative.
Ordered takeout a couple of times , service was fast and friendly but the food tasted more like microwave food .

I love this place. It's clean, nice, and the food is great. They have happy hour and are inexpensive when it's not happy hour. My favorite is the crispy honey chicken and their egg rolls. Their sushi is yummy too. They have decently priced drinks with quick and attentive service. My only complaint is that when they are super busy there is one server in particular that seems  unfriendly. We frequent this place at least once a month. I would recommend this place to people who are looking for a place that is inexpensive, casual yet nicer than your typical family restaurant, and tasty with a good variety.

It has been a while since I came here for lunch. Wow! Their menus and the food has improved so so much. I ordered Pad Thai from their lunch menu and it was amazingly delicious. It is spicy to my liking. They are very generous on the meat portion as well as the noodles. I enjoy every bite of it.
